sen.j: 山部王（やまべのおおきみ、生年不詳 - 天武天皇元年7月2日 (旧暦)？（672年7月31日？））は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: Yamabe no Okimi (year of birth unknown - July 31, 672?) lived in the Asuka period.
Yamabe no Okimi (year of birth unknown - c. July 31, 672) was a person lived in the Asuka period.
sen.cmt: c. を補い、クエスチョンマークを削除しました。was a person を補いました。
sen.e: Yamabe no Okimi (year of birth unknown - c. July 31, 672) was a person lived in the Asuka period.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは「やまべのおほきみ」。
sen.e: In old Japanese syllabary characters, his name is called "YAMABE no Ohokimi".
In old Japanese syllabary characters, his name is read 'YAMABE no Ohokimi.'
sen.cmt: called→read,クォーツ、ピリオドの位置を修正しました。
sen.e: In old Japanese syllabary characters, his name is read 'YAMABE no Ohokimi.'
He was a member of the Imperial family, but his lineage is unknown.
He was a member of the Imperial Family, but his genealogy is unknown.
sen.cmt: Imperial family→Imperial Family,lineage→genealogy と修正しました。
sen.e: He was a member of the Imperial Family, but his genealogy is unknown.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱で大友皇子（弘文天皇）の将となったが、味方の蘇我果安、巨勢比等（巨勢人）に殺された。
sen.e: He was a general of Prince Otomo's army during the Jinshin war in 672, he was killed by SOGA no Hatayasu and KOSE no Hito.
He was the general of the army of the Prince Otomo (the Emperor Kobun) during the Jinshin war in 672, but he was killed by SOGA no Hatayasu and KOSE no Hito.
sen.cmt: the, but を補いました。a→the と修正しました。（弘文天皇）を補いました。
sen.e: He was the general of the army of the Prince Otomo (the Emperor Kobun) during the Jinshin war in 672, but he was killed by SOGA no Hatayasu and KOSE no Hito.

sen.j: 壬申の乱の際に、美濃国に本営を設けた大海人皇子（天武天皇）に対し、大津の近江宮にあった朝廷は、数万の軍勢を派遣した。
sen.e: During the Jinshin war, the Imperial court based in Omi no miya palace in Otsu province sent tens of thousands of soldiers to Mino province where Prince Oama's headquarters was located.

During the Jinshin war, the Imperial Court based in Omi no miya palace in Otsu sent tens of thousands of soldiers to Mino Province where the headquarters of the Prince Oama (the Emperor Tenmu) was located.
sen.cmt: court→Court,Otsu province→Otsu,Mino province→Mino Province と修正しました。the を補いました。（天武天皇）を補いました。
sen.e: During the Jinshin war, the Imperial Court based in Omi no miya palace in Otsu sent tens of thousands of soldiers to Mino Province where the headquarters of the Prince Oama (the Emperor Tenmu) was located.

sen.j: 琵琶湖東岸を進んだ軍の指揮官は、山部王、蘇我果安、巨勢比等であった。
sen.e: The commanders in the army taking the east coast of Lake Biwa were Yamabe no Okimi, SOGA no Hatayasu and KOSE no Hito.
The commanders in the army taking the east coast of Lake Biwa were Yamabe no Okimi, SOGA no Hatayasu and KOSE no Hito.
The commanders in the army taking the east coast of Lake Biwa were Yamabe no Okimi, SOGA no Hatayasu and KOSE no Hito.

sen.j: 敵の前線拠点がある不破まで約20キロメートルの犬上川のほとりに陣をおいたとき、蘇我果安と巨瀬比等は山部王を殺した。
sen.e: When they build their headquarters by the Inukami-gawa River about 20km to Fuwa where the enemy's battlefront base was located, SOGA no Hatayasu and KOSE no Hito killed Yamabe no Okimi.
When they placed their camp by the Inukami-gawa River about 20 km to Fuwa, where the enemy's battlefront base was located, SOGA no Hatayasu and KOSE no Hito killed Yamabe no Okimi.
sen.cmt: build→placed,headquarters→camp,スペースを修正しました。カンマを補いました。
sen.e: When they placed their camp by the Inukami-gawa River about 20 km to Fuwa, where the enemy's battlefront base was located, SOGA no Hatayasu and KOSE no Hito killed Yamabe no Okimi.

sen.j: この混乱で軍の前進は止まり、蘇我果安は返って自殺した。
sen.e: Due to this chaos, the army stopped to advance and SOGA no Hatayasu came back by himself and committed suicide.
Due to this chaos, the army stopped to advance and SOGA no Hatayasu came back by himself and committed suicide.
Due to this chaos, the army stopped to advance and SOGA no Hatayasu came back by himself and committed suicide.

sen.j: 以上を伝える『日本書紀』は、殺害の原因に触れない。
sen.e: "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), didn't say anything about the cause of the murder.
The "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) which describes above mentioned incident, does not say anything about the cause of the murder.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。「以上を伝える」の部分を補いました。didn't→does not と修正しました。
sen.e: The "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) which describes above mentioned incident, does not say anything about the cause of the murder.

sen.j: 7月2日の項に続けて書いており、この日の前後か当日に事件が起きたと考えられる。
sen.e: As this incident was reported in the section of July 2, this may have happened around in or on this date.
As this incident was reported in the section of July 2 (old calender), this may have happened around in or on this date.
sen.cmt: 7月2日は旧暦のものと思われるため、(old calender)と補いました。
sen.e: As this incident was reported in the section of July 2 (old calender), this may have happened around in or on this date.

sen.j: 書紀の中で山部王の名はこれより前の別の箇所にも現れる。
sen.e: Name of Yamabe no Okimi appeared in a different section in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
Name of Yamabe no Okimi appears in a preceding different section in Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: appeared→appears と修正しました。preceding を補いました。クォーツを削除しました。
sen.e: Name of Yamabe no Okimi appears in a preceding different section in Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan).

sen.j: 大海人皇子の子、大津皇子は父の挙兵を知って味方とともに脱出した。
sen.e: Prince Otsu, a son of Prince Oama, escaped with his followers from the capital after he found out that his father had taken up arms.
The Prince Otsu, the son of the Prince Oama, escaped with his followers from the capital after he found out that his father had taken up arms.
sen.cmt: the を補いました。 a→the と修正しました。
sen.e: The Prince Otsu, the son of the Prince Oama, escaped with his followers from the capital after he found out that his father had taken up arms.

sen.j: 6月25日深夜に鈴鹿関に至り、そこで大海人皇子が張った封鎖線にかかった。
sen.e: Prince Otsu got to Suzuka-no-seki Checkpoint at midnight and was stopped by a blockade Prince Oama had setup.
The Prince Otsu reached Suzuka-no-seki Checkpoint at midnight of June 25 (old calender), and was stopped by the blockade the Prince Oama had setup.
sen.cmt: the, カンマを補いました。 got to→reached,a→the と修正しました。6月25日を補いました。（旧暦と思われますが年号が明らかでないので、old calender を補いました）
sen.e: The Prince Otsu reached Suzuka-no-seki Checkpoint at midnight of June 25 (old calender), and was stopped by the blockade the Prince Oama had setup.

sen.j: このとき鈴鹿関司は大津皇子らを山部王と石川王だと誤認した。
sen.e: At this time, Suzuka-no-seki Checkpoint officials misidentified Prince Otsu as Yamabe no Okimi and Ishikawa no Okimi.
At that point, the Suzuka-no-seki Checkpoint officials misidentified the Prince Otsu as Yamabe no Okimi and Ishikawa no Okimi.
sen.cmt: this time→that point と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: At that point, the Suzuka-no-seki Checkpoint officials misidentified the Prince Otsu as Yamabe no Okimi and Ishikawa no Okimi.

sen.j: 理由は書紀に明記されないが、敵味方不明の地を行く際に、少年だった大津皇子の存在を隠し、従う者の誰かが山部王らの名を騙った可能性がある。
sen.e: No reason was mentioned in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), but it is possible that Prince Otsu's followers hid Prince Otsu's identify because he was a minor, and named Yamabe no Okimi since they couldn't identify friend or foe.

No reason is mentioned in Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan), but it is possible that the Prince Otsu's followers hid the Prince Otsu's identify because he was a minor, and a follower falsely called himself as Yamabe no Okimi since they could not identify friend or foe.
sen.cmt: was→is と修正しました。the を補いました。クォーツを削除しました。named Yamabe no Okimi→a follower falsely called himself as Yamabe no Okimi,couldn't→could not と修正しました。
sen.e: No reason is mentioned in Nihonshoki (Chronicles of Japan), but it is possible that the Prince Otsu's followers hid the Prince Otsu's identify because he was a minor, and a follower falsely called himself as Yamabe no Okimi since they could not identify friend or foe.

sen.j: もしこの推測が正しいとすれば、山部王と石川王はどちら側からも殺されずにすみそうな、態度のはっきりしない人物と考えられていたことになる。
sen.e: If this assumption is correct, Yamanobe no Okimi and Ishikawa no Okimi had not made up their mind so that they were not targeted from both sides.
If this assumption is correct, Yamanobe no Okimi and Ishikawa no Okimi had been considered as ones who did not make up their mind so that they were not targeted from both sides.
sen.cmt: 文半ばを文脈に応じて修正しました。
sen.e: If this assumption is correct, Yamanobe no Okimi and Ishikawa no Okimi had been considered as ones who did not make up their mind so that they were not targeted from both sides.
